description: Borrowed from Italian vendetta (“revenge”), from Latin vindicta. See vindicate, avenge.

entries.meaning: A bitter, destructive feud, normally between two families, clans, or factions, in which each injury or slaying is revenged: a blood feud.
(often preceded by personal) A motivational grudge against a person or faction, which may or may not be reciprocated; the state of having it in for someone.
